Alli_Walker:
{{short description|Canadian country musician and model}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Alli Walker | image = Alli Walker.jpg | caption = Walker performing at Toronto's Festival of Beer in 2024 | image_size = | background = solo_singer | birth_date = {{Birth based on age as of date|29|2019|10|25}}{{cite web|url=https://www.alive.com/lifestyle/alli-walker-music-with-a-conscience/|title=Alli Walker: Music With a Conscience|first=Carimé|last=Lane|work=[[Alive (magazine)|Alive]]|date=October 25, 2019|access-date=September 12, 2024}} | birth_name = | birth_place = | alias = | origin = [[Summerside, Prince Edward Island]], Canada | instrument = Bagpipes, drums, guitar, piano, vocals | genre = {{hlist|[[Country music|Country]]|[[country rock]]}} | occupation = Singer, songwriter, model, multi-instrumentalist | years_active = 2009-present | label = Records Nashville | website = {{official|https://www.alliwalker.com/}} }} '''Alli Jean Walker''' is a Canadian [[country music]] singer, songwriter, and model from [[Summerside, Prince Edward Island]]. She is currently signed to Records Nashville.{{cite web|url=https://www.sonymusic.ca/press_release/rising-country-star-alli-walker-signs-with-records-nashville|title=RISING COUNTRY STAR ALLI WALKER SIGNS WITH RECORDS NASHVILLE|work=[[Sony Music Canada]]|date=March 13, 2024|access-date=May 18, 2024}} ==Early life== Walker grew up in [[Prince Edward Island]]. After learning the piano and drums, she learned how to play the [[bagpipes]], and attended several international bagpiping competitions. Walker turned down a scholarship to the [[University of Arkansas]], as she was inspired by [[Taylor Swift]] to pursue a career in [[country music]].{{cite web|url=https://spotlightonbusinessmagazine.com/in-the-spotlight-alli-walker-islander-brings-her-pipes-to-music-city/|title=In the spotlight – ALLI WALKER – Islander brings her Pipes to Music City|work=Spotlight on Business Magazine|access-date=May 18, 2024}} She attended the [[University of Prince Edward Island]] for one year as a vocal major, but elected to drop out as the program was focused on classical training. In 2009, Walker moved to [[Toronto, Ontario]] to pursue a career in [[country music]] and modelling.{{cite web|url= https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/prince-edward-island/pei-summerside-musician-mental-health-music-1.5142234|title=Summerside native Alli Walker on why she calls her music 'conscious country'|first=Tony|last=Davis|date=May 20, 2019|work=[[CBC News]]|access-date=May 19, 2024}} She met her husband at a [[Rascal Flatts]] concert soon after moving to Toronto. ==Career== After ten years of developing her music, Walker released her debut album ''The Basement Sessions: What I've Learned So Far'' on September 13, 2019.{{cite web|url=https://www.notablelife.com/meet-alli-walker-the-woman-taking-a-more-conscious-approach-to-country-music/|title=Meet Alli Walker, The Woman Taking a More Conscious Approach to Country Music|first=Lauren|last=Ramesbottom|work=Notable Life|access-date=May 19, 2024}}{{cite web|url= https://www.saltwire.com/prince-edward-island/lifestyles/summerside-musician-alli-walker-releases-debut-cd-after-10-years-of-creating-it-362959/|title=Summerside musician Alli Walker releases debut CD after 10 years of creating it|date=October 12, 2019|newspaper=[[The Guardian (Charlottetown)|The Guardian]]|publisher=[[SaltWire Network]]|first=Sally|last=Cole|access-date=May 18, 2024}} She recorded the songs in the basement of her home with her husband.{{cite web|url= https://www.elixuer.com/features/alli-walker-country-music-singer-songwriter-and-multi-instrumentalist/|first=Arslan|last=Ahmed|title=Alli Walker, Country Music Singer-Songwriter and Multi-Instrumentalist|date=January 20, 2022|work=Elixuer|access-date=May 18, 2024}}{{cite web|url=https://procountrymusic.com/2019/04/11/alli-walker-finds-therapy-in-releasing-mindful-music/|title=Alli Walker Finds Therapy in Releasing “Mindful Music”|work=Pro Country|date=April 11, 2019|access-date=August 12, 2024}} Shortly thereafter, Walker and her husband moved to [[Kelowna, British Columbia]].{{cite web|url=https://kess11.medium.com/celebrating-her-small-town-roots-alli-walkers-home-town-home-c35abee46589|title=Celebrating Her Small Town Roots — Alli Walker’s “Home Town Home”|first=Donna|last=Block|work=Medium|date=June 22, 2022|access-date=May 18, 2024}} She subsequently released her second album ''Growing Up'' on March 10, 2023.{{cite web|url=https://atlantic.ctvnews.ca/growing-up-p-e-i-country-artist-alli-walker-releases-her-most-personal-album-1.6335548|title=Growing Up: P.E.I. country artist Alli Walker releases her most personal album|first1=Natalie|last1=Lombard|first2=Katie|last2=Kelly|work=[[CTV News]] Atlantic|date=March 20, 2023|access-date=May 18, 2024}}{{cite web|url= https://frontporchmusic.ca/alli-walker-female-canadian-country-artist/|title=[SPOTLIGHT] Canadian Women Of Country: Alli Walker|first=Jenna|last=Weishar|work=Front Porch Music|date=April 6, 2023|access-date=May 18, 2024}} The album included the single "Red Wine or Whiskey", and several previously released songs including "Country Music", "Maybe I'm Still Drunk", and a female point-of-view version of "[[Sand in My Boots]]".{{cite web|url= https://nowandthenmagazine.com/blogs/latest-news/posts/7167100/music-s-journey-podcast-interview-202-w-breakout-canadian-country-artist-alli-walker-just-released|title=Music's Journey Podcast INTERVIEW #202 w/ Breakout Canadian Country Artist Alli Walker Just Released Her New Single and Sophomore Album ‘’Growing Up''|work=Now and Then Magazine|date=March 10, 2023|location=[[Toronto, Ontario]]|access-date=May 18, 2024}}{{cite web|url=https://frontporchmusic.ca/alli-walker-sand-in-my-boots-morgan-wallen/|title= Alli Walker Responds to Morgan Wallen With “Sand In My Boots (Female POV)”|work=Front Porch Music|date=December 9, 2022|first=Junior|last=Walker|access-date=May 18, 2024}} Later that year, Walker released the song "The Whiskey's Gone".{{cite web|url= https://canadianbeats.ca/2023/08/31/alli-walker-has-released-her-new-diddy-the-whiskeys-gone/|title=ALLI WALKER HAS RELEASED HER NEW DIDDY “THE WHISKEY’S GONE”|first=Nanci|last=Dagg|date=August 31, 2024|work=Canadian Beats Media|access-date=May 18, 2024}} The song garnered significant attention on social media, and Walker subsequently moved with her husband to [[Nashville, Tennessee]], at the end of the year, and released the song "Hung Up". {{cite web|url=https://www.hotpress.com/music/watch-alli-walker-releases-music-video-to-accompany-her-hit-track-whiskeys-gone-22998589|title=Watch: Alli Walker releases music video to accompany her hit track 'Whiskey's Gone'|date=December 1, 2023|work=Hot Press|first=Niamh|last=Browne|access-date=May 18, 2024}}{{cite web|url=https://www.raisedrowdy.com/2023/12/08/alli-walker-steps-into-her-next-chapter-with-hung-up/|title=Alli Walker Steps Into Her Next Chapter with ‘Hung Up’|work=Raised Rowdy|date=December 8, 2023|access-date=May 18, 2024}} In March 2024, Walker signed her first record deal with RECORDS Nashville and released the single "I Like Big Trucks".{{cite web|url= https://frontporchmusic.ca/alli-walker-signs-major-deal-records-nashville/|title=Canadian Artist Alli Walker Signs Major Record Deal With RECORDS Nashville|date=March 12, 2024|first=Jenna|last=Weishar|work=Front Porch Music|access-date=May 18, 2024}}{{cite web|url=https://musicrow.com/2024/03/alli-walker-signs-with-records-nashville/|title=Alli Walker Signs With RECORDS Nashville|first=Madison|last=Hahnen|work=Music Row Magazine|date=March 8, 2024|access-date=May 18, 2024}}{{cite web|url=https://ca.billboard.com/music-news-digest-music-pei-awards-country-artist-alli-walker-signed-in-nashville-more|title=Music News Digest: Music PEI Awards, Country Artist Alli Walker Signed In Nashville & More|first=Kerry|last=Doole|date=March 13, 2024|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] Canada|access-date=May 18, 2024}} In April 2024, Walker received a significant amount of media attention after she performed her song "Creek" at a [[Nashville Predators]] playoff hockey game and drank beer from the mouth of a dead [[catfish]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.tennessean.com/story/sports/nhl/predators/2024/04/29/nashville-predators-alli-walker-beer-catfish/73500250007/|title=Who's the Nashville artist drinking beer from catfish at Predators playoff game?|first=Marcus K.|last=Dowling|work=[[Nashville Tennessean]]|date=April 29, 2024|access-date=May 29, 2024}}{{cite web|url=https://www.si.com/nhl/2024/04/29/predators-alli-walker-chugs-beer-catfish|title=Singer Alli Walker Chugged a Beer From a Dead Catfish While Performing at Predators Game|work=[[Sports Illustrated]]|first=Stephen|last=Douglas|date=April 29, 2024|access-date=May 29, 2024}}{{cite web|url=https://www.news.com.au/sport/sports-life/singer-performs-sickest-tradition-in-sport-goes-viral/news-story/dfea92b13f01333d89b71c1fa67fea5d|title=Singer performs sickest tradition in sport, goes viral|first=Tyson|last=Otto|work=[[News.com.au]]|date=May 3, 2024|access-date=May 29, 2024}} A video of the incident was later shown on [[Hockey Night in Canada]] as well as an [[ESPN]] national broadcast in the United States.{{Cite web|url=https://countrytown.com/news/alli-walker-does-a-shoey-out-of-a-catfish/QmD4VFdWWVg/11-05-24|title=Alli Walker Does A Shoey Out Of A Catfish|first=Mary|last=Varvaris|work=Countrytown|date=May 11, 2024|access-date=May 29, 2024}} Walker received a nomination for Female Artist of the Year at the [[2024 Canadian Country Music Awards]].
